Live from NPR News in Washington I'm nor rom us stocks are lower again today after around yesterday they pushed the Dow industrial down more than eight hundred and thirty points as NPR's John Ydstie reports so far the losses are much smaller today
The Dow fell about a hundred and thirty points to the opening bell but a positive report on us consumer inflation help support the market which bounce back and forth between losses in games in early trading
Then some negative news from the White House on trade tensions with China pushed duck slower at the morning session the Dow is down over three hundred and Seventy point it regain most of that ground later
Investors are worried about trade issues and rising interest rates which are negative for stocks President Trump again criticized the fed for raising rates saying the fed is out of control and making a mistake
John Ydstie NPR News Washington
Trump says results of an investigation into the disappearance of Saudi journalist Jamal because show gay may be released soon in the meantime as NPR's Ayesha Rascoe reports Trump is pushing back against calls from both parties in Congress for the U.S to stop arms sales to Saudi Arabia
The U.S will take action against Saudi Arabia is is determined that Saudis harm Jamal ... but he said he does not want to impose sanctions that will prevent the Saudi Government from buying US military equipment
I don't like the concept of stopping and investment of a hundred and ten billion dollars into the United states because you know what they're going to do they're going to take that money has been to Russia or China or someplace else

Hundreds of thousands of homes and businesses are without power in the southeast us today after hurricane Michael it came ashore along the Florida Panhandle just shy of a category five before weakening to a tropical storm over South Carolina North Carolina governor Roy Cooper says it's now in his state
The ragged but still raging remains of hurricane Michael have now come to North Carolina [noise] the storm has already been done to lash our battered stay with strong winds and heavy rain
The storm is expected to move into Virginia by tonight the national Hurricane Center says parts of North Carolina and Virginia could be life threatening flash floods
The state Supreme Court in Washington today struck down the death penalty saying that it's been applied in an arbitrary and racially discriminatory manner Washington is now the twentieth state to outlaw capital punishment
At last check on Wall street the Dow is down a hundred and eighty nine points the icing the is down twenty three the NASDAQ down eleven [noise] this is NPR News from Washington
A judge in New York state today dismissed as sexual assault charge against former movie producer Harvey Weinstein prosecutors did not object citing information they obtain since that charge was filed
There are five other sexual assault charges still pending wind staying has pleaded not guilty to all of them as well as accusations of sexual misconduct including rate from scores of women going back decades
Officials in Indonesia are extending the search and rescue effort that began after a powerful earthquake and tsunami struck the island is still a wasting nearly two weeks ago Michael Sullivan reports the official death toll has their class two thousand
Officials say volunteers and relatives of the missing will be allowed to continue their search is hoping to find at least the bodies of those they lost nearly two weeks and there's almost no hope of finding anyone alive
The official search effort we'll end with mass prayers in some of the hardest hit neighborhoods of polo the official tally of the missing stands at six hundred and thirty but no one really knows how many victims remain buried under the rubble the national disaster mitigation agency says the number could be as high as five thousand
Tomorrow the government will begin focusing on their next challenge rebuilding for NPR News I'm Michael Sullivan in Chiang Rai Thailand
Another earthquake struck Indonesia today and had a magnitude of six and ... job on Bali islands officials say three people were killed
